feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: [SAP Build Process Automation] Desktop Agent does not synchronize deployed projects and stuck logs
entry.content:
Dear SAP Build Process Automation Community:

I'm having a persistent and very frustrating issue with my SAP Build Process Automation desktop agent. It doesn't seem to sync deployed projects despite seemingly correct configuration and several troubleshooting attempts. I would greatly appreciate any help, suggestions, or diagnostics based on your experiences.SAP Build Process Automation 

 

The core problem (with the desktop agent!):

My Desktop Agent (v3.37.57 on Windows 11) constantly displays the message "It appears no projects have been received yet" in the "Projects" window. Most worryingly, its local logs ("History/Events") are completely blocked, showing the last activity as [Exact date of capture, e.g., June 9, 2025], even though it is [Current date, e.g., June 18, 2025].

This indicates that the agent is not processing or updating its status locally, nor is it downloading projects that have been deployed.

 

Project context and configuration (Everything looks fine in the cloud!):

I've set up a project to automate the mass update of fixed asset master records in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The cloud configuration appears to be correct:

Project: Mass Update Asset Master Data (57O).
Cloud Status: Deployed and started in RPADeveloper environment (confirmed in "Environments" > "Projects").
Automation Launcher: The Mass Update Asset Master Data (57O) artifact (Automation Launcher type) is configured with the main automation (MassUpdateAssetMasterData) in the "Start Manually from Agent" section.
Agent Connection to Cloud:
In the BTP lobby (Environments > RPADeveloper > Agent Management), my agent (NDTSCZ1166) appears as "Inactive" and "Connected".
In the agent's local settings (Configuration > Tenants), the connection to efdadad3trial.us10.process-automation.build.cloud.sap is "Active".

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation - Add a Document Template Error
entry.content:
I am trying to create an artifact for a Document Template in SAP Build on BTP Trial. However, when I select the option to create a Document Template, I receive the following error:

"SAP_IPA_28014: The requested Document Information Extraction service operation could not be completed."

This error is preventing the creation of the template.

I have already assigned the role 'Document_Information_Extraction_UI_Templates_Admin' to my account.

Could you please help resolve this issue?

SAP Build 
SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: How to Handle Script Task Limit Exceeded Error in process Automation for Email Body Generation
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on an automation in SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) where we need to fetch data from an API and include it in the body of an email. Without the use of Agent.
Here’s the scenario:

  • We are using an HTTP action to call the API and retrieve the data.
  • A script task is used to convert the API response (which contains a responseArray with multiple EDIDC and EDID4 objects) into an HTML table to be used as the email body.
  • The script generates the HTML content and stores it in the context variable $.context.htmlTable.

However, we are facing an issue because the data size exceeds the 100 KB limit for the script task in BPA, 
"Script Task" failed
Error message: Execution of task 'script_1' has been stopped while executing the statement [<...], as it reached the time limit

. The API response can contain a large number of records, and converting this into HTML is causing the script to go beyond the allowed limit.

Here is the script we are using

// Step 1: Get the API response
var responseArray = $.context.action_get_getZidocZidoc_1.result.responseArray;
 
// Step 2: Validate response
if (!responseArray || responseArray.length === 0) {
throw new Error("No records found");
}
 
// Step 3: Escape HTML
function escapeHtml(text) {
text = (text === null || text === undefined) ? "" : String(text);
return text.replace(/&/g, "&").replace(/</g, "<").replace(/>/g, ">");
}
 
// Step 4: Build table rows
var rows = "";
for (var i = 0; i < responseArray.length; i++) {
var edidc = responseArray[i]["EDIDC"] || {};
rows += "<tr>" +
"<td>" + escapeHtml(edidc["DOCNUM"]) + "</td>" +
"<td>" + escapeHtml(edidc["IDOCTP"]) + "</td>" +
"<td>" + escapeHtml(edidc["MESTYP"]) + "</td>" +
"<td>" + escapeHtml(edidc["CREDAT"]) + "</td>" +
"<td>" + escapeHtml(edidc["SNDPRN"]) + "</td>" +
"<td>" + escapeHtml(edidc["RCVPRN"]) + "</td>" +
"<td>" + escapeHtml(edidc["STATUS"]) + "</td>" +
"</tr>";
}
 
// Step 5: Final table
var html = "<h3>IDOC Report</h3>" +
"<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>" +
"<tr><th>DOCNUM</th><th>IDOCTP</th><th>MESTYP</th><th>CREDAT</th><th>SNDPRN</th><th>RCVPRN</th><th>STATUS</th></tr>" +
rows +
"</table>";
 
// Step 6: Store in context
$.context.htmlTable = html;



Could you please suggest a solution or workaround to handle this limit exceeded error? Some ideas we are considering include:

  • Splitting the data into smaller chunks and processing them in multiple script tasks.
  • Using an external service to generate the HTML and call it via an action.
  • Any other best practices or standard approaches in BPA for handling large datasets in script tasks.

    Any guidance or examples would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

entry.title: What's the future of SAP technical consultant?
entry.content:
With the introduction of next-generation technologies like SAP BTP, ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), SAP Build (LCNC tools), and SAP Joule (AI), it's clear that SAP is moving towards a clean core, cloud-based future.

However, in reality, many organizations are still operating on legacy ABAP systems, and real-world adoption of these new tools remains limited. With the end of ECC support by 2027, this gap raises some concerns.

❓Key Questions:

1. What is the realistic future for SAP technical consultants in this evolving landscape?

2. Is it practical to invest time in RAP, BTP, or AI tools, given the current slow adoption?

3. Are any real projects or clients actively implementing these technologies?

Would appreciate insights from those currently working on RAP or BTP-based projects or involved in modern SAP implementations.

Thank you!

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation – Email Task Not Rendering HTML Content
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m currently working on a project using SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) where one of the steps involves sending an email with formatted data retrieved from an API.

To generate a well-structured email, I created an HTML table from the API response inside a Script Task and passed it to the Send Email task using the emailBody field. However, I noticed that:

The Email Task in BPA does not support HTML rendering.
As a result, the email recipient receives the raw HTML code as plain text — all the <table>, <tr>, <td> tags are visible in the message instead of a formatted table.

Example of What I See in the Email:

 

<table>
<tr><td>Item</td><td>Quantity</td></tr>
<tr><td>ABC</td><td>10</td></tr>
</table>

Instead of this being rendered as an actual table, the entire string is sent as-is in the email body.

Questions: 
1 : Is there any supported method to send HTML-formatted content via the Email Task in BPA?
2: Are there any plans from SAP to allow email attachments or HTML rendering in future releases? Without using Agent.
Any help, insight, or recommendations are appreciated!

Thanks

entry.title: Find the Bug 🐞 Formatting dates and times in Build Apps
entry.content:
Someone sent me a problem they were having in a private message, that made me chuckle.

To be honest, after 2 years of war and 2 weeks of intense war, and having to live out of a suitcase for a week in Athens because my plane was diverted and could not enter my country -- this was a fun, amusing diversion (it actually made me laugh).

Here's the message I received:

FORMAT_DATETIME_WITH_TIMEZONE(DATETIME("2025-04-03T02:00:00.000Z"), "MMM d, yyyy", "America/Chicago")

"I am using formula to format the date. Actually the output should be Apr 2, 2025, 9 pm. But I am getting Apr 3, 2025, 9 pm. How to solve this? I tried multiple ways. It's only changing time but not date. I used other timezone format as well. Please help. This is an issue in production."

After running the formula in my Build Apps and getting the same result, I assumed it was a bug in the tool (@Mari and @Pekka_Aaltonen, please forgive me). For the programmer, the obvious thing to think was that you asked for the date in the format April 2 (because it had to give the day before because the time zone they gave was minus 6 hours from UTC) and instead it was giving April 3. Why? Probably because the formula was too stupid to return the previous day's date.

It was supposed to show this:

But kept showing this:

But, alas, there was a perfectly logical explanation, but it was hidden because of the actual date and time used in the example. Another case of all-too-human error.

Can you find the bug?

P.S.: If you like this puzzle, wait for Devtoberfest in October. We'll have plenty more.

entry.title: Why can't I assign list or object values as outputs in Decision Tables in SAP BPA?
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (BPA), I'm defining a Decision with the following input/output structure:

  • Inputs:

    • Question (string)

    • Answer (string)

  • Outputs:

    • NextQuestion (string)

    • ProbableAnswers (array of strings) → for example: ["Yes", "No", "Maybe"]

Problem:

  • The output parameter NextQuestion appears in the Decision Table and I can assign values to it.

  • But the output parameter ProbableAnswers (array) does not appear at all in the Decision Table UI.

My Questions:

  1. Why does BPA Decision Table hide output fields that are of type array or object?

  2. Is there any way to assign structured outputs (like a list or object) from within a Decision Table?

  3. Is the only workaround to flatten everything into strings, or should I use a script task or external service to return complex objects?

What I Tried:

  • Defined the output type in the decision as:

    {
  "name": "ProbableAnswers",
  "type": "array",
  "items": { "type": "string" }
}

  • But the field is completely missing from the Decision Table output columns — I can't assign or return it.

SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: How can we store static data in SAP Build Process Automation and access it in a Decision Table?
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (BPA), I want to store a set of static configuration data — for example, a JSON file that contains a list of Yes/No questions along with next-step logic.

I understand that BPA allows uploading static artifacts like JSON files into the project, but:

 My Questions:

  1. Can I access this static JSON data from within a Decision Table?

  2. If yes, how can I reference or read that static file inside a Decision Table?

  3. Is there a recommended way to make BPA Decision Tables dynamically configurable using such static files?

 What I'm Trying to Do:

I want to avoid hardcoding all rows in the Decision Table. Instead, I’d prefer:

  • Storing a JSON or CSV file with the step-by-step rules

  • Having the Decision Table evaluate against that static data

  • Or programmatically update the table from that file (if possible)

Example JSON I want to use:

[
    {
        "step": 1,
        "question": "Is the requestor an employee?",
        "yesNext": 2,
        "noNext": "STOP"
    },
    {
        "step": 2,
        "question": "Is the budget approved?",
        "yesNext": 3,
        "noNext": "STOP"
    }
]
SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: Meeting Reviewer and Chatting app - Firestore as backend.
entry.content:
I'm using Firestore as my database

I need help here, I'm creating social sharing app, where other users can post reviews and rate the author's post and also connect via direct messages (like a messaging app). 

For Review & Rate: I've structured my data with Reviews as a list if objects in SAP and Reviews as array of map in Firestore.

On the Clients side (SAP) I have created 2 page variables for the review; 

  1. pageVars.feedback_array (array of objects)
  2. pageVars.new_feedback (an object) with properties; comment, like (vouch), current_user, createdAt.

The submit button has fires a page variable 1. set to

INSERT_ITEM_AT(pageVars.feedback_array, 1000, {id: appVars.Users.id, user: appVars.Users.name, vouch: pageVars.new_feedback.vouch, comment: pageVars.new_feedback.comment, createdAt: NOW()})

the set page Variable node is connected to the Update Record node, it fires a success. but in the Firestore document the review record is replaced by the new submission. The funny thing is that if I press the submit button multiple times say 5 times, it'll update those 5 records in Firestore, but after a minute or more when I repeat the same process it'll erase the 5 records and replace with the new ones. but I want it to append to the array. Anyone please help and thank you in advanceFirestore data structure

INSERT_ITEM_AT(pageVars.feedback_array, 1000, {id: appVars.Users.id, user: appVars.Users.name, vouch: pageVars.new_feedback.vouch, comment: pageVars.new_feedback.comment, createdAt: NOW()})

entry.title: Booster for the new SAP Build
entry.content:
Hi, SAP Builders

When I try to use Booster with my new SAP Build Developer license, the service plan option doesn't appear, even though I've added the entitlements. This is significantly affecting my use of SAP Build Apps and Process Automation, because configuring everything manually causes things to fail.

For example, when I deploy an app, I get an error with the destination: 404 /undefiniedB1/, and with SAP Build Process Automation, it says "Destination not defined."

I've even thought it's a service issue because these destinations work perfectly for me with another subaccount with a free, standard, etc. service plan.

Is it known when we might have a Booster for the service plan for the new commercial model?

Kind regards,

Erick

entry.title: Issue with ENOTFOUND Error in SAP Build Process Automation When Calling OData Service
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I'm currently working on SAP Build Process Automation and facing an issue while trying to consume an OData service in my workflow.

Destination configuration details in the sub account -

Proxy Type: OnPremise

Authentication: BasicAuthentication

Additional Properties: 

sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled = true

sap.processautomation.enabled = true

sap.build.usage = odata_gen

sap-client = 200

WebIDEUsage = Mobile

HTML5.DynamicDestination = true

Content-Type = application/json

The OData service is already deployed in actions and accessible from SAP Build, 

but while testing the automation, I am getting the following error:

{
"type": "automationActivity",
"name": "irpa_core.log",
"label": "Get entities from btpStatus",
"inputs": [
"Action execution resulted in ENOTFOUND with message getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND sap2dev.ormat.com",
{
"key": "Error",
"value": 1
},
null,
true
],
"containerInstanceUid": "22088b84-5108-4cd6-9180-eb2744befb47",
"parentInstanceUid": "22088b84-5108-4cd6-9180-eb2744befb47",
"stepId": "4",
"line": 21,
"file": "statusUpdateOdata.js"
},

{
  "label": "getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND sap2dev.ormat.com",
  "parentInstanceUid": "00453074-c80a-b760-e576-a25a1f7d0e64",
  "containerInstanceUid": "5e569caa-b259-4fb8-b51a-176caadab2fb",
  "line": 2,
  "file": "bundle.js",
  "exception": "irpa_core.error.Error",
  "stack": "Error: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND sap2dev.ormat.com     at Object.b [as cast] (C:\Users\saprpa\AppData\Local\SAP\Intelligent RPA\Projects\65287c4f-0b70-414b-a2f4-bccc626dca35\dist\bundle.js:2:204356)     at y.start (C:\Users\saprpa\AppData\Local\SAP\Intelligent RPA\Projects\65287c4f-0b70-414b-a2f4-bccc626dca35\dist\bundle.js:2:284311)     at async Object.p [as startJob] (C:\Users\saprpa\AppData\Local\SAP\Intelligent RPA\Projects\65287c4f-0b70-414b-a2f4-bccc626dca35\dist\bundle.js:2:278002)"
}

 

Can we use Proxy Type: OnPremise for OData services in SAP Build Process Automation, or is it recommended (or required) to use only Proxy Type: Internet (HTTP)?

I would appreciate clarification on whether OnPremise destinations are fully supported in SAP Build Process Automation workflows, especially when calling OData services inside automations.

 

Best Regards

Divan Wellalage

entry.title: Build Workflow with SAP Build Process Automation: A Step-by-Step Demo on Invoice Validation Approval
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In this blog, we’ll walk through the steps to create your very first process using SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA). We’ll implement an Vendor Invoice Validation and Approval Process, where a Finance Clerk submits a vendor invoice, and a Finance Manager approves or rejects it. You'll also learn how to set up your environment in a SAP BTP trial account, configure prerequisites, and monitor your workflow execution.

Understanding SAP Build Solutions

SAP Build is a comprehensive suite of low-code/no-code tools that empowers citizen developers and business users to create applications and automate processes without extensive coding knowledge. The SAP Build portfolio consists of three main components:

SAP Build Apps

  • Create and extend business applications
  • Drag-and-drop simplicity for app development
  • No coding skills required

SAP Build Process Automation

  • Create workflows and automate repetitive tasks
  • Unifies workflow management and intelligent robotic process automation
  • Streamlines business process management

SAP Build Work Zone

  • Create beautiful business websites and corporate portals
  • Centralized access to business applications and content

All these tools leverage drag-and-drop functionality, making them accessible to users without programming expertise.

Prerequisites

  • SAP BTP Trial Setup
  • Ensure that you have a SAP BTP trial account with the following services enabled:   
  • A. SAP Build Process Automation (Free Tier or Standard Plan)
    • Navigate to Service Marketplace > Search for SAP Build Process Automation
    • Click Create Application if it’s not already available.

                  

  • B. SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS)
    • Configure IAS (Identity Authentication Service).
    • Either use the default IAS tenant of your BTP trial or configure an additional tenant or default plan if needed.        

Subscribe to SAP Build Process Automation and Cloud Identity Service into your sub-account.         

  • Role Collection Assignment in BTP Cockpit
  • Assign the following role collections to the user you’ll log in with:                 

Go to BTP Cockpit > Security > Users

Select the IAS user and assign above role collection

  1. Establish Trust with IAS
  2. Go to BTP Subaccount > Security > Trust Configuration
  3. Add a new Identity Provider if you are using a custom IAS tenant
  4.  Enable trust for that IAS and assign the user created in IAS

Step 1: Accessing SAP Build Process Automation

  1. Navigate to your SAP BTP subaccount
  2. Go to Services → Instances and Subscriptions
  3. Open the SAP Build Process Automation application
  4. You'll be directed to the SAP Build Lobby - the central entry point for all SAP Build tools    

Step 2: Creating a Business Process Project

  1. In the SAP Build Lobby, click the Create button
  2. Select Build an Automated Process
  3. Choose Business Process
  4. Create a new project with these details:
    • Project Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process Form
    • Description: A invoice validation and approval process form project
  5. Click Create

The project acts as a container to hold the business process and all related artifacts.              

Step 3: Creating the Business Process

  1. Within the project, create a new business process:
    • Process Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process
    • Description: A invoice validation and approval process
  2. Click Create                  

The Process Builder will open with a vertical layout (an improvement from the previous horizontal layout) featuring a convenient side panel for better usability.

Hands-On Demo: Creating a Vendor Invoice Validation Approval Process

Let's dive into a practical example by creating a complete vendor invoice validation approval process. This demo will involve three key personas.

Business Personas Involved:

  1. Business Expert/Citizen Developer: Creates and designs the business process
  2. Finance Clerk: Uses the vendor invoice order from to initiate the process
  3. Finance Manager: Reviews and approves.rejects vendor invoice orders.

                    

Step 4: Creating the Vendor Invoice Submission Form (Trigger)

  1. Click Add a Trigger
  2. Select Submit Form (one of three trigger methods: Form, API, or Event)
  3. Click Blank Form
  4. Configure the form:
    • Form Name: Vendor Invoice Submission Form
    • Description: Form to collect vendor invoice order
  5. Click Create               

Step 5: Designing the Vendor Invoice Approval Form

  1. Click Open Editor to access the form designer
  2. Add form elements using drag-and-drop:
    • Heading: "Vendor Invoice Approval Forms"
    • Subheading: "Vendor Invoice Submission Form review by Finance Manager"
  3. Add required fields:
    • Vendor Name (Text field)
    • Invoice Number (Number field, required)
    • Invoice Date (Date field, required)
    • Vendor Email (Text field, required)
    • Invoice Amount (Number field, required)
    • Due Date (Date field, required)
  4. Mark fields as required where necessary
  5. Save the form       

Step 6: Creating the Approval Form

  1. Click Add Process Step (plus icon)
  2. Choose Approval
  3. Click Blank Approval
  4. Configure the approval form:
    • Name: Vendor Invoice Approval
    • Description: Vendor Invoice order form for review
  5. Click Create

Step 7: Designing the Approval Form

  1. Click the three dots and select Open Editor
  2. Design the form with:
    • Heading: "Sales Order Form for Review"
    • Subheading: "Sales order form for review by sales manager"
  3. Add the same fields as the trigger form:
    • Vendor Name
    • Invoice Number
    • Invoice Date
    • Vendor Email
    • Invoice Amount
    • Due Date
  4. Set all fields to Read Only (since this is for review)
  5. Add additional text field for manager comments
  6. Save the form

Step 8: Configuring the Approval Form

  1. Configure the approval settings:
    • Subject: "A Vendor Invoice [Vendor Name] form is waiting for your "
    • Priority: High
    • Users: Process started by (for simplification)
  2. Map inputs from the trigger form output:
    • Vendor Name→ Vendor Name field
    • Due Date → Due Date field
    • Invoice Number → Invoice Number field
    • Vendor Email → Vendor Email field
    • Invoice Amount → Invoice Amount field
  3. Save the configuration                     

Step 9: Creating Notification Forms

Approval Confirmation Form:

  1. Click Add Process Step → Form → Blank Form
  2. Configure:
    • Name: Vendor Invoice Order Confirmed
    • Description: Form to handle confirmation
  3. Design with:
    • Heading: "Vendor Invoice form approved successfully. No further action required."
    • Subject: "Your Vendor invoice [Vendor Name] form is confirmed!"
    • User: Process started by
  4. Save the form              

Rejection Notification Form:

  1. Go to Project Overview
  2. Duplicate the Order Confirmed form
  3. Modify the message:
    • Heading: "Invoice rejected. Please review remarks and resubmit after corrections."
    • Subject: "Your Vendor invoice [Vendor Name] has been rejected                   

Step 10: Connecting the Process Flow

  1. Connect the rejection notification to the "Rejected" path of the approval form
  2. Connect the approval confirmation to the "Approved" path
  3. Ensure both paths lead to the process end                      

Step 11: Understanding the Release Process

Why Release Before Deployment?

Before any business process can be executed by end users, it must go through two critical phases:

  1. Release: Creates a versioned snapshot of your project
  2. Deploy: Makes the released version available in runtime environment

Initiating the Release

  1. Locate the Release Button: In the top-right corner of your project interface
  2. Click Release: This opens the release configuration dialog

Release Versioning System

SAP Build Process Automation uses semantic versioning with three components:

  • Major Version (X.0.0): Significant changes, incompatible with previous versions
  • Minor Version (1.X.0): New features, backward compatible

First Release

For a newly created project, you'll see the default version 1.0.0. Add a meaningful release note such as "First release" and proceed.

Patch Changes (1.0.X)

  • Minor text modifications
  • Small UI adjustments
  • Bug fixes

Minor Changes (1.X.0)

  • New features added
  • Workflow enhancements
  • Backward-compatible improvements                       

Step 12: Deployment Process

Accessing Deployment Options

Once your project is released, the Deploy button becomes available. The deployment process involves:

  1. Click Deploy: Opens the deployment configuration
  2. Select Environment: Choose your target runtime environment

Understanding Environments

Public Environment

  • Accessible by all users in the subaccount
  • Suitable for organization-wide processes
  • Default choice for most scenarios

Deployment Execution

Select "Public" as your environment and click Deploy. You'll notice the project status changes from "Released" to "Deployed" and becomes "Active."       

Step 13: Process Execution and Testing

Accessing the Deployed Process

Once deployed, your process becomes executable through multiple channels:

  1. Direct Form Link: Browser-accessible URL
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Integration: Embedded as tiles
  3. SAP Launchpad Service: Integrated into portal environment         

Testing Scenario: Invoice Validation Approval Process Form

Phase 1: Finance Clerk Representative Role

Navigate to the deployed process and access the form link. As a finance clerk, fill out the order form:

Sample Data:

  • Vendor Name: ABCD Company
  • Invoice Number: 1234
  • Invoice Amount: $1,000
  • Due Date: 2 days from current date
  • Vendor Email : test@gmail.com
  • Invoice Date : 01/08/2025

Submit the form to initiate the workflow process.                           

Phase 2: Finance Manager Approval

  1. Access Inbox: Navigate to SAP Build Lobby > My Inbox
  2. Review Submission: Examine the submitted order details
  3. Make Decision: Choose to approve or reject based on business criteria

In our example:

  • Vendor Name: ABCD Company
  • Invoice Number: 1234
  • Invoice Amount: $1,000
  • Due Date: 2 days from current date
  • Vendor Email : test@gmail.com
  • Invoice Date : 01/08/2025

Decision: Approved with comment "This order can be fulfilled"      

Phase 3: Confirmation Process

After manager approval:

  1. Automatic Notification: System sends confirmation to finance representative
  2. Representative Action: Acknowledges receipt of approval
  3. Process Completion: Workflow concludes successfully

                        

Step 14: Process Monitoring and Analytics

Accessing Monitoring Tools

Process administrators can monitor workflow performance through: Path: SAP Build Lobby > Monitoring > Process and Workflow Instances

Key Monitoring Features

Process Instance Overview

  • Start time and initiator
  • Current status (Running, Completed, Failed)
  • Environment and version information
  • Instance ID for tracking

                     

Conclusion

SAP Build Process Automation is transforming the way organizations approach workflow digitisation by placing powerful automation tools directly in the hands of business users. As Demonstrated in our Invoice Validation Approval Process scenario, even non-technical users - like functional consultants or business experts - can quickly build, configure and deploy intelligent workflow using drag-and-drop interfaces, without writing code.  

From creating triggers  forms and configure approval steps to sending dynamic notifications, SBPA provides all the essential building blocks to automate repetitive tasks and improve collaboration across roles. Its tight integration within the SAP BTP and its ectensibility with tools like SAP Build Apps make it to go-to solutions.

By empowering citizen developer, SBPA not only reduces IT backlogs but also fosters a culture of innovations and continous improvement across teams. Now is the time to explore your business landscape, identify time-consuming manual process and turn them into streamlined intelligent workflows that deliver  measurable business value.

entry.title: Automation project cannot run with desktop agent
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I was creating an automation project in build process automation according to docu:

process-automation-enablement/Workshops/Workshop A - short/1 The Basics at main · SAP-samples/process-automation-enablement · GitHub 

Everything worked for me. When triggering the automation manually the Desktop agent runs the automation. When releasing the projekt and submitting my form, the automation gets stuck in this state and doesnt trigger the Agent to run in.

There is no error msg. Just stuck in this state for a day now

In my environment i registered my agent and added a custom attribute

Attribute is also added to my Project.

 

The Agent is installed on my local computer and has latest version. its in Unattended Mode, so it should register new projects.

This is my process:

this is the automation:

Greetings

Rouven
